intro: Sabatia anceps, commonly known as the narrowleaf sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and typically grows in sandy or rocky soils. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy pink or purple flowers. It is often found in open habitats such as fields and dunes. Its botanical characteristics make it well adapted to coastal and inland dune environments.
